info.title: nbsapi API (v2)
info.description: ## NBSAPI v2 An enhanced API for interoperability between digital tools that help to build and manage nature-based solutions with advanced features. > **Version Navigation:** > - Switch to v1 API (basic functionality) > - Current: **v2 API** (enhanced with GeoJSON and Projects) > > The "Servers" dropdown shows the base URL for API requests. ### Key Concepts #### Nature Based Solutions Solutions that are inspired and supported by nature, which are cost-effective, **simultaneously provide environmental, social and economic benefits** and **help build resilience**. v2 enhancements: - **GeoJSON Geometry**: Define solution boundaries with standardized GeoJSON (Point, LineString, Polygon) - **Styling Properties**: Configure visual appearance with color and visibility options - **Physical Properties**: Specify physical dimensions like depth, width, and inflow rates - **GeoJSON Output Format**: Get solutions as standard GeoJSON for direct use in mapping applications #### Adaptation Targets Adaptation targets define and quantify the type of adaptation facilitated by a **Nature-Based Solution**, each having an associated value 0-100. The v2 API maintains the same adaptation target functionality as v1. #### Impacts These are the adaptation impacts of **Nature-Based Solutions**. An impact has a **magnitude**, an **ImpactIntensity**, and an associated **ImpactUnit**. v2 enhancements: - **Specialized Impact Types**: - **Climate Impacts**: Temperature reduction, cool spots, evapotranspiration, groundwater recharge, storage capacity - **Water Quality Impacts**: Capture, filtering, and settling unit measurements - **Cost Impacts**: Construction and maintenance costs with currency specification #### Projects (New in v2) Projects allow you to group multiple Nature-Based Solutions together with shared settings, targets, and spatial contexts. Key features: - **Scenario Settings**: Define project configurations like coping mechanisms (heat, flood, drought) - **Performance Targets**: Set climate and water quality targets for the project - **Spatial Context**: Define project boundaries and map settings - **Solution Collections**: Group multiple solutions into a cohesive project

get.description: Retrieves a specific nature-based solution by its ID with full details including geometry, styling, and physical properties

patch.description: Update specific fields of an existing nature-based solution while keeping other fields unchanged

get.summary: Get a nature-based solution as GeoJSON Feature
get.description: Returns a GeoJSON Feature representation of a specific solution, with the solution properties included

post.description: Search for nature-based solutions using filter criteria like spatial bounds, adaptation targets, and impact intensities

schema.title: Response Get Solutions V2 Api Solutions Solutions Post

post.description: Create a new nature-based solution with enhanced v2 features like GeoJSON geometry, styling, and physical properties

schema.title: Response Read Impact Intensities V2 Api Impacts Intensities Get
Response Read Impact Units V2 Api Impacts Units Get

get.description:
Retrieve all impacts for a solution, including specialized impact data
if available.

schema.title: Response Read Solution Impacts V2 Api Impacts Solutions  Solution Id  Impacts Get

post.description:
Create a new impact for a solution with optional specialized data.

Specialized impacts can include:
- Climate impacts (temperature reduction, cooling, etc.)
- Water quality impacts (filtering, etc.)
- Cost impacts (construction, maintenance)

get.description: Retrieve a specific impact with specialized data
Retrieves a list of all available projects with their associated nature-based solutions

schema.title: Response Read Projects V2 Api Projects Get

post.description: Creates a new project with optional settings, targets, and associated nature-based solutions

404.description: One or more solutions not found

get.description: Retrieves a specific project by its ID with all associated solutions and settings

patch.description: Updates specific fields of an existing project while keeping other fields unchanged

delete.description: Permanently deletes a project (this operation cannot be undone)

schema.title: Response Delete Existing Project V2 Api Projects  Project Id  Delete

post.description: Adds an existing nature-based solution to a project
